0.cdata!: Republique de Guinee - Quatrieme Projet Routier

theme: Rural services and infrastructure,Infrastructure services for private sector development

abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the Fourth Highway
            Project for Guinea was satisfactory. The project achieved
            most of its objectives, its impact on institutional
            development has been substantial, sustainability is
            uncertain, and the performance of the Bank was satisfactory
            while the Borrower's was deficient. Several lessons can
            be learned from this project. First, adequate funds for
            routine maintenance should be secured from user payments and
            allocated to the project as counterpart funds. Second,
            before the start of works, project counterpart funds
            required for contracts should be completely paid up front as
            an advance payment. Third, other generic issues, such as
            procurement, custom duties, taxes, and procedures for
            payment of local funds, should be addressed globally through
            institutional development assistance. Fourth, technical
            assistance should be made available for the short term, with
            clear and monitorable objectives and performance indicators
            that can be assessed frequently and included in the
            consultants' contracts. Fifth, local staff should be
            motivated and made responsible for project implementation
            and sector management. Finally, the development of routine
            maintenance, executed by private local contractors, should
            include support to the MTPE road management unit.
